alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 1:47PM EDT until further notice by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Otter Creek At Middlebury affecting Addison County. For the Otter Creek...including Center Rutland, Middlebury...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Otter Creek at Middlebury. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM EDT Sunday was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.3 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 09/02/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EDT.
